text: J.-B. Martin's old weaving factory (French: "Ancienne manufacture de moulinage J-B. Martin") is a historic building in Tarare, Rhône, France. The silk- weaving company was founded in 1843, and the buildings, designed by architect Eugène-Toussaint Cateland, were completed in 1860. They were abandoned in 1939, in the midst of World War II. It has been listed as an official historical monument since October 29, 1987. ==References== Category:Buildings and structures in Rhône (department) Category:Commercial buildings completed in 1860 Category:1843 establishments in France Category:Companies established in 1843 Category:1939 disestablishments in France Category:Monuments historiques of Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes
title: J.-B. Martin's old weaving factory
